text: Leo Pons, born on October 4, 1996, in Aurillac, is a French director. ==Biography== He is widely recognized for directing successful films that showcase the Cantal region, such as "The Hobbit: The Return of the King of Cantal," a parody feature film based on J. R. R. Tolkien's novels and Peter Jackson's films, and "Le Buron," a 23-minute thriller filmed in Cantal that intertwines local legends and history. For the latter, Pons received several awards, including Best Thriller and Best Director at the Los Angeles Film Festival "VIDEO. Le Cantal s'inspire du "Hobbit" de Peter Jackson pour attirer les touristes", fr.news.yahoo.com "A 17 ans, Léo Pons projette ce soir le 2e opus de sa parodie, inspirée du Seigneur des anneaux", lamontagne.fr"Cantal, What Else?", un Auvergnat parodie Clooney et Dujardin", france3-regions.francetvinfo.fr or Le Buron, a 23-minute thriller shot in Cantal blending local legends and history.
